entry.title: Elmer Smith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in 1920, Elmer Smith (pictured) hit the first grand slam in World Series history?

entry.title: Geographia Sacra seu Phaleg et Canaan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Bochart's 1646 Geographia Sacra seu Phaleg et Canaan was the first full-length book devoted to the Phoenicians?

entry.title: Ossian D'Ambrosio (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that heavy metal led Ossian D'Ambrosio to druidism?

entry.title: wedding of Grover Cleveland and Frances Folsom (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the wedding of Grover Cleveland and Frances Folsom had the president walking his own bride down the aisle?

entry.title: William of Littlington (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that William of Littlington opposed the division of England and Scotland into two Carmelite provinces in 1303, was excommunicated, and did four years' penance in Paris?

entry.title: Cardigan Donuts (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Cardigan Donuts has sold a Super Mario Kart–inspired rainbow doughnut with white chocolate frosting, gold walnuts, and cereal marshmallows?

entry.title: board game cafés (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that board game cafés can be found across the world?

entry.title: Need for Speed Unbound (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the title for Need for Speed Unbound was accidentally revealed early on Electronic Arts' website?
